website_summaries.verdict: A junior version of the popular adult game with cards all ages will understand.
pros: Players match descriptions to objects, people, or places
The simple game has hilarious results
While this is geared toward readers, some of the funniest results can be randomly selected
A fun game for the whole family
cons: The game cards play heavy on pop culture for kids, which might make it outdated quickly or hard for some adults to understand

website_summaries.verdict: A silly word association game without too many rigid rules.
pros: An inexpensive game with plenty of cards to keep things interesting
It can also be combined with the kids set or adult version for more variety
Easy to get the hang of with short rounds
A great choice to help kids learn new vocabulary
cons: There are no pictures on the cards

customer_reviews.title: really disappointed - this is not the same version as just ...
customer_reviews.text: really disappointed - this is not the same version as just a few years ago - it is really heavy with pop culture references - lots of tv shows & references to Nickelodeon - we don't watch those shows with our kids - we didn't know many of the people & shows listed on the cards - super frustrating - not the game it used to be
customer_reviews.author: happy family

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the kids
customer_reviews.text: My kids love the original game so I thought they'd love this too. It is cool but I had to go through all of the cards and pull out the ones they don't know. My kids don't watch Nickelodeon so that eliminated a pretty good stack of cards. I'm kind of bummed about that because it seems like a waste. Some of the other cards are the same as in the adult game. Overall, the game is still fun. We could have probably stuck with the original game though.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney L Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Love this game...but NO UPDATED CARDS same one for 2015
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed and false advertising!!!! It shows UPDATED CARDS...but when I received it is the same one I already own from 2015 NO UPDATED CARDS. So if you are buying this because you want updated cards don't buy it from here. I will be returning and going to the store to look for one with updated cards. 5 Stars for the game it's self but 0 stars for the seller!!!
customer_reviews.author: Always buying

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We have the original Apples to Apples game and my kids( ages 10-14) really didn't get a lot of the words and actors and what not in that game. A little over their head. Now my husband and I got it cause a lot of that stuff was in our days when we were young. We ended up getting the Jr version and it is just perfect!!! Couldn't have been more pleased. More current things in it: Star Wars, Disney channel, videos games and what not related stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Buschman

customer_reviews.title: KNOCK OFF!!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: This is not the original apples to apples junior. It has extremely simplified word cards. No real definitions. Also even more importantly IT HAS NO PICTURES!!!! Duh kinda the point of apples to apples. I know the original kids version has both because my bff and her kids have it and i have played it with them. This is a knock off. Do NOT waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Most Fun Game for Everyone!
customer_reviews.text: I have loved Apples to Apples for years. I found out from our library that there is a kids' edition and we played it so much there, we decided to buy one of our own. This game is a lot of fun and it's really easy for most any age to join in. I love that you can really kind of play for a long time or get a short game in if you want. My only complaint is that this newer edition includes a lot of pop culture references that my kids and I don't really know.
customer_reviews.author: RZK

customer_reviews.title: Words are easier to read and understand for younger crowd.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this game for my 7 year old for Christmas. My family would usually play the original version during get togethers. My daughter would usually be partnered up with an adult because she needed help reading and understanding the majority of the words. The junior version is great for her. Now she can play on her own against all of us. The concept is exactly the same, but the words are easier to read and understand. It makes playing so much more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids & Adults!
customer_reviews.text: This version has more things kids will be familiar with. The Standard Adult version had things like "Cher", "Oprah"...but this game is geared towards children and it's rare if their is something on the cards they don't know. Easy to play. Same rules as the regular version. So much fun...my 4-year-old and 6-year-old love it. We have to read the cards to my 4-year-old...but we all take turns voting and everything.
customer_reviews.author: ortbort

customer_reviews.title: Great Game -- Apple to Apple
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughters aged 8 and 11 just love playing Apple to Apple, Jr. We have a set here for them to play when visiting and we gave the youngest one a set for her birthday. She was thrilled. She immediately set up a FaceTime connection so we could all play it long-distance. Great fun.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Everhart

customer_reviews.title: Just not fun...
customer_reviews.text: It's just plain a not fun game. It's trying to be Cards Against Humanity for kids, but there's nothing funny about it. 95% of the time there's not a card for the situation but even when there is it amounts to "hairy shoe" or something like that. Even my 8 and 10 year old were bored.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: great game
customer_reviews.text: I work for a daycare center and the kid’s from 3rd grade and up love this game. It is fun to play. Causes lots of laughter by all . even the adults like playing. So I bought it as a gift for my preteen niece. She is having fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Charl

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Game
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful game for young and old. The game box says for 9 and up, but we played with an 8 and a 6 year old and they both loved it. If they didn’t understand the word, they either asked the meaning or looked on the card, which explained the meaning. I highly recommend this game for families. It’s fun and provides lots of laughs, as well as improving language skills for youngsters.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Genius game
customer_reviews.text: This game is arguably more fun for the adults that are playing it with the kids than for the kids themselves. But they seem to love it too. Associations are something that we do get better at, but man is it fun seeing the kids piece together disparate ideas. So we're playing and learning? Great game, great gift.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Engaging game
customer_reviews.text: Entertaining game to play with younger children. I am a teacher and bought this for my class. My students love the game and I do too. It gets everyone to engage and learn new vocabulary. It also has a great price. I would recommend this to anyone with younger children for home or school use.
customer_reviews.author: zerof1703

customer_reviews.title: We love this game
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure whether to buy this version or the regular one. Thought that the regular one was too mature for my kids just yet (not adult content, just more older kid understanding of topics). My kids are 9, 9, 11, and 16. From the first game, we had a blast! It is so funny and entertaining seeing what everyone comes up with and chooses. W have played about 20 times and it is still the first game we go for out of lots of great games!
customer_reviews.author: M. Baucom

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Our family with 11, 8 and 5 year old children have a blast playing this game. Adaptable for a quick week night game or we can play longer on the weekend by changing the rules up. The children have even come up with other games to play by using these cards. Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kaila

customer_reviews.title: Kid-friendly and educational
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game. It has definitions of the terms on the cards and has more child- friendly words on the cards. The directions give you an option to have everyone explain why their card is the best choice. I use this in a classroom and turn it into a persuasive word game. It's not as exciting as the regular version, but much-more kid friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Erica L Ladu

customer_reviews.title: Great family game
customer_reviews.text: Our boys 6 & 10 both love this game. It helps the younger one practice his reading, we do have to help him with some words, but he doesn't seem to mind if someone knows what cards he has. They find it hysterical to pick the funniest card they can find to play. We took this to the beach and the grandparents enjoyed playing with us also. We will often play past the rule of first to 4 cards wins & just keep playing until we get tired of it. When we are tired of it, we count to see who won the most rounds!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Proven

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Game (10 years +)
customer_reviews.text: My family loves the original Apples to Apples, but it was difficult for my younger kids to play. This Junior game is great for 10 year olds, but some of the topics are still a bit old for my 8 year old. Still very fun though. We also purchased the Apples to Apples Big Picture version and that one is perfect for ages 4 and up.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki B

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: This is a super fun game and easy to learn. My kids all love playing it with me and they also love to just play amongst themselves. I gave it four stars because I feel like it’s a little bit expensive but I am glad that it comes with such a large amount of cards.
customer_reviews.author: Crista

customer_reviews.title: This was a perfect vacation gift for my 8 year old grandson.
customer_reviews.text: The funny combinations were amusing. His reading level was up to the challenge and we all enjoyed playing this game. We had played the adult version, but didn't feel that this "younger" version was too easy for the older folks among us. All in all...it was a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L. Fedorov

customer_reviews.title: No USABLE!
customer_reviews.text: NON RETURN-ABLE Item doesn't tell you that majority of questions related to "Nicolodean" shows
customer_reviews.author: BEATRIZ LEE

customer_reviews.title: Stacks Up Well Versus Adult Version
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for 10 year old that was a huge hit and he kept asking to play it again afterwards. Had played the adult version in a group setting and was pleased to find a tamer version that wasn’t overly cheesy or “babyish” as I was a little nervous he really liked the adult one a lot. Adults and kids had fun playing this version and roles were reversed in the kid explaining to the adult what certain things were/meant (pop culture references). Would buy an expansion pack!
customer_reviews.author: Arasin Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great family game
customer_reviews.text: My twelve year old asked for this game to play with her friends when they come over. They play this game for hours at a time. We also play it as a family. My six and seven year old are able to play as well and helps them expand their vocabulary .
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Great game! I got this for my son's 10th birthday. He wasn't thrilled when he opened it, as he would rather have an electronic type of game and isn't one to sit and finish a board game. I got it specifically because it would be a game he could have fun with and not get bored. He ended up loving it. It' brings a lot of laughs moves quickly. My 5 y.o. even has a great time playing. She can't read yet, so her card choice always makes it interesting;)
customer_reviews.author: KNoelle

customer_reviews.title: Great words except the pop culture references
customer_reviews.text: Way too many pop culture references!! Idk what kids know all these people and movies and crap.
customer_reviews.author: Missy B.

customer_reviews.title: Kid-friendly References
customer_reviews.text: Even as an adult, there are a lot of cards I discard when playing Apples to Apples because the references are so obscure! The junior version is just as clever and witty as the original, but is much more accessible and relevant. Worth the buy, even if you usually don't buy the junior versions of games.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Fun game!
customer_reviews.text: My hubby bought this exact game from Thinker Toys for like $34. I immediately made him return it and ordered the exact same one here on Amazon for more than half the cost. 🤗 It arrived the very next day. Played it with our kids for family game night and it was so fun. They loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessalyn De Leon

customer_reviews.title: This game is mind boggling
customer_reviews.text: I think Apples to a Apples is possibly the worst game of all time. I don’t recommend it under any circumstance. I refuse to play it, even when begged by my adorable children. It makes me angry. There are no rules to awarding points. Pure anarchy. The only thing this game is good for is inciting riots. To my horror, my children enjoy playing it, likely because they wholeheartedly love bickering. Godspeed to anyone who makes the grave mistake I made.
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannon

customer_reviews.title: Great family game
customer_reviews.text: Our favorite game over winter break to play to grandparents. Compared to the adult version, references and examples are a lot easier to follow. Worked well for my 4 year old, as long as she was on someone’s team.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Too many cards from cartons or kid programs.
customer_reviews.text: Love the game but there were many cards that the people playing did not know.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Game
customer_reviews.text: After watching the adults play the original Apples to Apples our kids tried to join in but they were a little too young. We purchased the Jr version and they love it. The cards a age appropriate for young readers and include words/topic that the kids can understand and enjoy while still be something parents can play along with.
customer_reviews.author: BigBTree

customer_reviews.title: Fun game, you need to be able to read!
customer_reviews.text: So I'm probably the only person on the planet who experienced this - but maybe the comment will help someone else. This is a great, fun game. I love it! Five stars all the way - the ONE thing I was expecting (again, probably the only person this would ever happen to...) was pictures like the kid-version of Apples to Apples. I bought this, hoping for cards that weren't the same as the other game (oh, I think it's Disney version) but that my kids could play. No problem for my older daughter and husband, but frustrating for my 5-year old who is just learning to read. Stick with the Disney version for little ones.
customer_reviews.author: lumic69

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware- could not return!!!!
customer_reviews.text: *****Buyers beware****!!!! Bought not realizing it was junior version but would not allow me to return it within two weeks??!! Never had this problem before with amazon but I don’t return things often- will use caution when purchasing in future!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My mother in law got this for my daughter. She loves apples to apples. We decided to get jr because it was easier for my youngest to understand and play with us. There are some questionable words in here, but they can just be taken away.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hood

customer_reviews.title: Great game for a family
customer_reviews.text: Great game lots of fun for our family of 5. Ages 8, 10, and 12. There were some words or people that they didn't know who or what the word was. But an overall great game!
customer_reviews.author: Paula M.

customer_reviews.title: This game makes us laugh
customer_reviews.text: Our family plays this game all the time we enjoy it so much we get so many laughs and that’s so worth it good price good value was delivered quickly
customer_reviews.author: ladynla78

customer_reviews.title: Just like original
customer_reviews.text: It’s just like the normal version of Apples to Apples, but with out references that go over children’s heads. (Although my kids don’t know what most of the tv show references are) It is played the same way, and my kids really enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Buy this Junior version!
customer_reviews.text: The adults that I play games with like this version better than the adult version, and then we only need one version no matter what ages play anyway. (The adult version tends to have pop culture references that not all people know.) We once had a group of four adults and four children playing, and liked it so much that we played all day until we went through all the cards twice. Kids as young as 7 or 8 can play this if they are avid readers, but occasionally they will need help with meanings.
customer_reviews.author: OhioJLo

customer_reviews.title: Great game! I teach English in Korea
customer_reviews.text: Great game! I teach English in Korea. The adult version is too hard. But this is perfect. Some of the references (culturally speaking) they didn't understand and a few of the cards were too difficult for some of the levels. That being said, my students love this game. It encourages them to relay thoughts into English as well as letting them argue, thus improving debate skills. Looking at getting the version for even younger kids or the Disney version. But, so far not available for international shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Maranwae

customer_reviews.title: A good game for children learning to read.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my granddaughter. We play by the rules and make up our own. She was struggling with reading. This game has helped her reading immensely. She is now ahead. She was wayyyyy behind. A fun way to learn without them realizing it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Miller

customer_reviews.title: Super fun game for the family!
customer_reviews.text: We went to a resort last year and they had this game, but the adult version. My family had a blast playing it several times. However, some of the words and examples were of a more adult theme that my kids didn't understand or hadn't heard of (Bill o'reilly). So I decided to try the kids version, and it's great. They can understand the terms and examples, and we can still be creative and silly! Overall great game!
customer_reviews.author: Pleauh

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed again
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived with large hole in the box and an ink smudge on the front. Very disappointing, as it was bought as a Christmas gift. This is the firs item that has arrived with similar damage to product packaging. Not sure what is going on.
customer_reviews.author: Weatherman

customer_reviews.title: Great game for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: Our family LOVES this game. We have a 1st grader and a 5th grader, and it is the perfect game for all of us. I love that it helps teach on so many levels: learning to associate uncommon words with one another, a healthy sense of debate, and how to have a good sense of humor. My first grader is at a third grade reading level, so this is just right for him, but it might be a bit advance for emerging readers. Highly recommend for family game night.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Sent me a damaged game!!
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality control. The shipping box was not damaged but the game box was crushed.
customer_reviews.author: Tynicoledesigns

customer_reviews.title: Kids over 12
customer_reviews.text: Topics were harder than expected for the junior version. Should be more like kids over 12...
customer_reviews.author: R L Myers

customer_reviews.title: Proud Poppy
customer_reviews.text: My five year old grandson had played this while visiting his cousin, my six year old granddaughter. I got it for him as a Xmas gift at his mom's suggestion. The little guy was stoked!!
customer_reviews.author: mike g.

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning new words!
customer_reviews.text: My niece is OBSESSED with this game! What I love about it, is that shes learning new words and enhancing her vocabulary without even realizing it. It's very easy to play too, just like cards against humanity but for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie M

customer_reviews.title: My Preteens love this game.
customer_reviews.text: My kids all love this game, especially my preteens. I don't think it is as fun as the original, but this one is definitely better for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got kids? This game is great!
customer_reviews.text: Got the game for Christmas and we all love it! Was a little concerned that my daughter would not be able to read the cards (she's 6yrs old). But she is able to play along with the rest of us just fine. Yes, some of the cards are above her reading level, but a quick look thru the cards and we were able to segregate the more challenging ones to a separate stack. The conversations that ensue during gameplay are truly magnificent. Definitely going to keep this game around for a long time. And when we're ready, we'll advance to the regular Apples to Apples game.
customer_reviews.author: 3aminspirations

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: very nice board game . our family loves playing this game for a family game night . its pretty popular during play dates . the price was good . the box came nicely packaged .
customer_reviews.author: Hercule

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our 8 & 6 year olds
customer_reviews.text: We got this game after my husband and I had played the more mature version with family (older nephews too) so we thought this was a good way to move on from our usual board games. Our children are 8 and almost 7 and they both love it! Great way to teach them some new words, and make them use their creativity with the answers that better suit "the judge", which also teaches strategy! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to play and fun to engage with your kids!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for early tweens. We have enjoyed playing it with their friends too-easy to learn and comical when it comes to voting and seeing personalities shine through!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun game, alternative expansion for cards against humanity if you are creative!
customer_reviews.text: The "nice" or "safe for work" version of "Cards Against Humanity" We also break this out when we plays CAH with a variant rule. We have our normal hand, and a hand of these. You can pick from either hand (or both on the multi-answer cards.) The judge closes their eyes while people pick to avoid knowing who placed what. It has led to some far dirtier things than even Cards against humanity alone has managed.
customer_reviews.author: Justus

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: My son always wants to play apples to apples but some of the people or ideas on cards he is still to young tonkkow so this is a good alternative abd great for the whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun family game but it might be nice to have one a little simpler. My 8 year old granddaughter still had a little difficulty with some of the words.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Millis

customer_reviews.title: Made a great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas gift for my 13 year old cousin; he always liked playing the regular version but that one has too many names of people he doesn't know. Got him the Jr. version and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: E.R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginning readers
customer_reviews.text: This game is great for early readers to practice reading skills. It is also enjoyable for adults to play with kids!
customer_reviews.author: Chloe J.

customer_reviews.title: Great game at great price
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this game! So much so we bought another as gift for the cousins. Great family game night game. Great price
customer_reviews.author: Heather Senn

customer_reviews.title: So Much FUN!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I like to play Cards Against Humanity and thought this would fit the bill for a family friendly game. Our 8 year old thinks this game is awesome. It's fun for us too! Definitely a hit!
customer_reviews.author: ashlynne

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game!
customer_reviews.text: What a fun game!!! I got this game for our family after we played it on vacation for the first time . My kids range from 8-22! I would say any younger than that would be difficult!
customer_reviews.author: Dorry

customer_reviews.title: I don't care if I win...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't matter if I'm playing the 'regular version' or this version with my children, this is still an extremely fun game. I always get a great laugh going for non-standard answers.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Filled with fun and laughs. The kids have enjoyed learning this game. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: LovesMomma

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Best game for kids, kids and adults, grandparents, kids, and parents.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis L. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Best game ever!
customer_reviews.text: Funniest game around! We always play with large groups, and everybody is cracking up! Sometimes we all play separately, sometimes in teams. Very easy to learn and great for young kids or adults. Junior version is just fine for adults as well! Kids have to be able to read unless they are on a team.
customer_reviews.author: Skye B.

customer_reviews.title: Good family game
customer_reviews.text: This is our grandchildren's favorite game but it's not so juvenile that adults can't enjoy playing with the kids.... a nice family game.
customer_reviews.author: Ken/Karen

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old niece likes this
customer_reviews.text: I gave niece this as a gift. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Swain

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for almost any agr
customer_reviews.text: I and my whole family from young grandkids to grandparents enjoying this fun game
customer_reviews.author: Henry Mcclary Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this game. We love the adult version but my kids didn't know many of the words so this is perfect! The whole family enjoys sitting and playing this game! Simple game. Not many rules. Easy to understand! Makes for an excellent family game. You'll want to play for hours.
customer_reviews.author: T. M. Vliet

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Game To Build Vocabulary
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite family board games! It’s a goofy learning game that the whole family can enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Fun party game for all age groups
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after trying to play regular Apples to Apples with my extended family, ranging in age from 7-60. There were more than a few uncomfortable moments with the regular game, so this version will be used when we have kids around from now on. This junior version has the same basic concept as the regular, but with items kids will know, not things like "skinheads" and "humphrey bogart" that are outside the normal 7 year old's knowledge. There is also less "my first kiss" kind of stuff in this game as well. I appreciate the gamemaker's efforts to still make this fun for adults, while being applicable to kids as well.
customer_reviews.author: Schnutch

customer_reviews.title: Great game with more understandable references, still rather pop culture oriented.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit disappointed to see so many television references. To be honest, we don't watch a lot of children's programming with our daughter, and when we do it's for a shorter period of time. That being said, we love apples to apples and with the junior edition have a much smaller stack of "what the heck is this" and "she won't know these" which was the hope :-)
customer_reviews.author: R. Gick

customer_reviews.title: Great game for kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought for kids as our middle child plays this game at school with friends during free time. He absolutely loves this game! He is 10 for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Wabih

customer_reviews.title: Great family fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game ! 2 adults, a 12 yr old and two 9 yr olds and we laughed nearly non stop!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Not the updated version-as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The item is advertised using a photo that indicates that this is the updated version. It is not the updated version. This is disappointing and I’ll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: happytxbaby

customer_reviews.title: Good for thinkers
customer_reviews.text: Love it or hate it! You have to play this with the right kind of kids. Doesn't work for everyone. If you enjoy twisted meanings, looking for the strange and being challenged to think out of the box, you might enjoy this. Since there are no right or wrong answers, it really is down to the group playing to make it a fun game. Good for kids and adults too.
customer_reviews.author: UK Expat

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Laughs and Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite game to play with my grandkids. Last time we had 4 generations joyously playing together. Lots of laughs and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl McCulley

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Game
customer_reviews.text: Have this as a gift for a 7 year old and he loves it. We’ve played with him and although we’re not current on all the kid related cards they give a nice description on the cards to help the adults 😂
customer_reviews.author: Micailah Soto

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift. The recipient loved it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Trini in Ossining

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant fun
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not, this is my 4 year-olds favorite game. We have to help her with the reading, of course, but she truly loves this game, expecially when she gets to pick the winner. She's not usually able to sit through a whole game, but we'll play a 6-8 rounds before she gets bored. In the meantime, she's getting a real boost to her vocabulary. My 6-year old loves it, too. She's an early reader and can read many of the cards on her own, so she feels like a big kid when she plays.
customer_reviews.author: Annilita

customer_reviews.title: fun, silly, interactive game
customer_reviews.text: This game is really fun to play with my kids. The product arrived on time. One player lays the green card and all other players lay the red card that they think would give the funniest answer to describe the green card laid. So for example if the judge lays a green card that says "curly" the red cards might be hair, hotdog, dog, etc. Then each player will try to convince the judge as to why their answer is best. It's fun for parents as well as the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Andrews

customer_reviews.title: My kids love this game and it is something we can play ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this game and it is something we can play as a family. I'll give positive reviews to anything that can distract from video games or TV these days!
customer_reviews.author: NE Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what is shown.
customer_reviews.text: This came on time and is exactly what is shown. Definitely a fun game for family night with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Kyley

customer_reviews.title: Should have got the regular version
customer_reviews.text: Good for the young kids but I find it a little boring as an adult and my 8 & 11 yr old do too. I wish I would have just got the regular version.
customer_reviews.author: Shanthony

customer_reviews.title: Great family fun!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for when the g-kids came and it was a hit. They were old enough to read the instructions and participate. It provided hours of fun for our family.
customer_reviews.author: DGROBBY

customer_reviews.title: Age 4-8. CAN NOT RETURN.
customer_reviews.text: Be absolutely sure you want product. Age range is only 4-8 yrs old. Didn’t realize that. Product CAN NOT be returned! Usually I check these things out but missed it on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi French Lovett

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for kids! Easy for them to understand how to play and what the cards mean.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: disappointed, there is no picture on the card.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I am disappointed. There is no picture! I played the one with pictures in my friend's home and I decided to buy one for my kids. I must have bought a wrong one because there is no pictures. To be honest, the one with pictures is much much better and more fun! It's a disappointed buy.
customer_reviews.author: pksmom

customer_reviews.title: Good for building vocabulary
customer_reviews.text: A fun game, easy to start playing right away. The junior version is fun for adults, and doesn't have all the obscure pop culture references that the regular version includes (even better for grownups in my opinion). It's really good for kids who need to build their vocabulary, since they'll be learning synonyms for easy words while they play. Sharpens your wit, too! Lots of fun conversation starters in this great game. Kids can play it with other kids, or with their grownups and have a jolly good time.
customer_reviews.author: NewtonsLawPreserved

customer_reviews.title: So much fun - and it's a learning game, too!
customer_reviews.text: I love this game, even as an adult. I purchased it for my 9-year-old niece for her birthday and she was very excited to receive it. Funny enough, she has no idea she'll be learning the entire time she plays it! Each card describes the word and helps players learn new vocabulary and the type of word it is (adverb, noun, etc). It's always a hoot to play with a group and see what people come up with - but since it's the Junior version, you don't have to worry about "adult topics," which I'm not interested in with my family group. Love this game!!
customer_reviews.author: Catlyn

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: So fun mykods and I will play for hours, very easy to play.
customer_reviews.author: JESSICA DOCKSTADER

customer_reviews.title: Great game for family night with younger kids
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this game, we play this every family game night. Parents will love it because the kids have to read and it helps with their vocabulary and comprehension.
customer_reviews.author: TOMMY Y LEE

customer_reviews.title: Educational and Fun to play for children & adults
customer_reviews.text: Fun and educational. Gives children the chance to learn many new words and the meanings while playing. Definitely more fun with more players
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay J

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Played with my 10 year old niece and it was good old fashion board game fun. Kept her away from her phone and interacting with us.
customer_reviews.author: ARB

customer_reviews.title: Great for family game night!
customer_reviews.text: My kids got this as a Christmas gift and it was pretty fun to play. My 13 year old found it less interesting then my 7 year old, because the pictures are more for younger kids, but it would be a fun game for a family to add to game night, nothing Inaproppriate at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Boring. Obviously made for the US only
customer_reviews.text: Boring. Obviously made for the US only. Junior?? Add some fun to it. Not recommended at all. Make your own. More fun and cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Family Game Night
customer_reviews.text: Was a little concerned that this game would be too childish for my older children and to advanced for the younger kids. This was not the case. This game is fun for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun and really easy for kids to play. We have played it a handful of times and still have new cards to play with, so it not boring or super repetitive.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Can't be returned
customer_reviews.text: I like the game but I ordered the Junior Apples to Apples by mistake. Just arrived this morning and I can't return it. I wanted to order the non-Junior game and even though I haven't opened the package and have the box (still cold) it can't be returned. So I will have to find a friend who has a younger child to give it to or try to sell in on Craigslist. This was a Prime order so I am surprised.
customer_reviews.author: berit

customer_reviews.title: This game came HIGHLY recommended to me by my 6th grade class
customer_reviews.text: This game came HIGHLY recommended to me by my 6th grade class. They wanted some fun games for indoor recess. The kids find it fun and entertaining. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley R.

product_meta.title: Mattel Games Apples to Apples Junior - The Game of Crazy Comparisons (Packaging May Vary), Red,Green, One Size (N1387)
product_meta.description:
Color:Red,greenAPPLES TO APPLES Junior-The Game of Crazy Comparisons!: The card and party game for ages nine and up. Players will delight in the crazy comparisons while expanding their vocabulary and thinking skills. The 576 cards provide hours and hours of fun! Ages 12 and older.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
"APPLES to APPLES JUNIOR brings the hilarious card and party game, Apples to Apples, to younger players. Players aged nine and up will delight in all the crazy comparisons, while expanding their vocabulary and thinking skills at the same time. The game is as easy as comparing apples to apples – just open the box, deal the RED APPLE cards to each player, and you’re ready to go! Players take turns being the judge. The judge starts each round by playing a GREEN APPLE card featuring a one-word characteristic such as Chewy, Amazing or Scary. The rest of the players must then look at the RED APPLE cards in their hands and select the one they think is best described by the judge’s card – will you play A Volcano, Unicorns or Burned Toast? When everyone’s RED APPLE cards are on the table, you should try to convince the judge that yours is the best match. You’ll find that table talk is a big part of the fun. Just wait until you hear all the clever – and not so clever – ways that people try to convince the judge to choose a particular card. Do your best, because if the judge picks your card, you win that round! The first player to win four rounds wins the game. With over 500 cards, each round is filled with surprising comparisons from a wide range of people, places, things and events. Fast-moving and refreshing, Apples to Apples Junior is easy to learn and fun to play. It’s the perfect game for kids, families and friends!"
feature_bullets: Apples To Apples is the hilarious comparison game where players are free to be totally subjective in deciding the outcome
Features two types of cards: Red Apple, which contains a noun phrase, and Green Apple, which contains an adjective
Each round is filled with surprising and outrageous comparisons from a wide range of people, places, things and events
Includes over 1,000 cards and collectible tin

Players select the Red Apple card from their hand that they think is most like a Green Apple card played by the judge The judge then selects the winner of that round, and everyone gets a chance to be the judge

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
